verses.verse: Concerning the Ammonites<WH1121><WH5983>, thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Hath Israel<WH3478> no sons<WH1121>? hath he no heir<WH3423>? why then doth their king<WH4428> inherit<WH3423> Gad<WH1410>, and his people<WH5971> dwell<WH3427> in his cities<WH5892>?

¶ Concerning Edom<WH123>, thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>; Is wisdom<WH2451> no more in Teman<WH8487>? is counsel<WH6098> perished<WH6> from the prudent<WH995>? is their wisdom<WH2451> vanished<WH5628>?

¶ Concerning Damascus<WH1834>. Hamath<WH2574> is confounded<WH954>, and Arpad<WH774>: for they have heard<WH8085> evil<WH7451> tidings<WH8052>: they are fainthearted<WH4127>; there is sorrow<WH1674> on the sea<WH3220>; it cannot<WH3201> be quiet<WH8252>.

¶ Concerning Kedar<WH6938>, and concerning the kingdoms<WH4467> of Hazor<WH2674>, which Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> shall smite<WH5221>, thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Arise<WH6965> ye, go up<WH5927> to Kedar<WH6938>, and spoil<WH7703> the men<WH1121> of the east<WH6924>.

¶ The word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> against Elam<WH5867> in the beginning<WH7225> of the reign<WH4438> of Zedekiah<WH6667> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, saying<WH559>,
